answers.answer: Hi,How are you? CVA, is nothing but cerebrovascular accident or stroke. The usual risk factors for this condition are atherosclerosis, thromboembolism, hypertension, diabetes, age, hypercholesterolemia, bleeding disorders etc. In you husband’s case, open heart surgery indicates he had blocks in the vessels supplying the heart, so the same could happen in the vessels of the brain.Due to CVA, there is a increase in intracranial tension and patient’s conscious level can alter, nausea or vomiting, headache, papilledema can occur. Is there any blood mixed sputum or difficulty in breathing? A CAT scan (a special X-ray study) of the brain is often done to show bleeding into the brain; this is treated differently than a stroke caused by lack of blood supply. A 2DEcho and carotid ultrasound would aid in confirming the diagnosis.I think you should take him to the hospital immediately for making the diagnosis and immediate initiation of treatment.Best..
